title: Weekly Wrap: Undervalued Stocks, Balancing Retirement and College Savings, and Funds Facing Key-Person Risk
text:
Editor's Picks

33 Undervalued Stocks

Here are our analysts' top ideas in each sector at the third quarter's end.



Is the Market 'Due' for a Downturn?

Maybe. Maybe not. Just don’t fall prey to the Gambler’s Fallacy.



7 Steps to Estimating Your In-Retirement Cash-Flow Needs

Rules of thumb may be too high for affluent retirees with high savings rates, but healthcare costs are a major swing factor.



The College Question

When the cost of college threatens retirement, how do you break it down?



Succession Concerns Limit These Funds' Long-Term Prospects

The departure of a star manager leaves a tough act to follow.

Portfolio Planning and Personal Finance With Christine Benz

How to Escape From a Lousy Health Savings Account

You may be switching to cut costs, but watch out: You may trigger additional fees along the way.

Should You Add Flavor to a Vanilla Bond Portfolio?

Christine Benz discusses what to think about when it comes to diversifying your bonds.

Mutual Funds and Exchange Traded Funds

3 Funds Favoring Wide-Moat Stocks

Get the details from our manager research team.

The Third Quarter in Bond Funds

Economic and political uncertainty headlined the fixed-income markets.



Active Funds May Look Better, but Still Not Great

Although the performance of actively managed funds improved in 2019's first half, the long-term picture favors passive strategies.



Be Wary of State-Owned-Enterprises

Foreign governments aren't always on your side.



Back-Door Access to an Excellent but Off-Limits Value Strategy

Diamond Hill Mid Cap shares approximately 70% overlap with its stellar but closed sibling Diamond Hill Small-Mid Cap.



Dodge & Cox's Recipe for Success

Contrarian picks, patience, and strong teams contribute to the fund family's solid long-term record.



Take Advantage of Mean-Reverting Prices With This Foreign Value ETF

Diversification and a low fee improve its appeal.

Stocks

Market Too Focused on Corteva's Near Term

We see long-term potential for this wide-moat seed and chemical producer.

Can Renewables Overtake Natural Gas in Power Generation?

Renewable energy has policy momentum, but gas generation offers reliability.



An Undervalued but High Uncertainty Biotech Firm

Intercept's NASH treatment could be approved years ahead of competition.



Will Brick-and-Mortar Weather the E-Commerce Storm?

Retail REITs in our coverage are undervalued and provide attractive dividend yields.



Capital One Deserves More Respect

We see an opportunity to invest in the exceedingly cheap shares.

Rekenthaler Report

Where Are the Economies of Scale?

Morningstar’s global study demonstrates that when funds become bigger, they don't necessarily become cheaper.

The Capital Markets (We)Work

In a healthy financial system, some IPOs will fail.

Advisor Insights

Multiple Beneficiaries and the Year of Death RMD

Contributor Natalie Choate navigates through the complexities.

The Long View

Alicia Munnell: Married Couples Are in the Retirement Danger ZoneThe prominent retirement researcher discusses Social Security's viability, the role of housing wealth, and a surprising new finding about married couple's retirement preparedness.

The Short Answer

What Is a Quantitative Fund?

Confused by quant investing? We break it down.

Market Trends

Strong Third-Quarter Returns in Fixed-Income Market

Dave Sekera explains the quarter in bonds.

description: We recap the week on Morningstar.com and note the most popular stocks, funds, and exchange-traded funds.
